oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Foster & Lloyd - Music City Album Review - Biff Collie - 1989-06-03
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of a music city album review, featuring Foster & Lloyd (performers/songwriters) and Biff Collie (host), for their album Faster & Llouder on June 3, 1989.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Foster & Lloyd talk about how they came up with their name and how it often got made fun of -- Foster & Lloyd talk about the song Faster & Louder -- Foster & Lloyd talk about choosing who sings lead and who sings back up vocals -- Foster & Lloyd talk about writing and recording Fair Shake with Guy Clark -- Foster & Lloyd talk about how they met Guy Clark -- Foster & Lloyd talk about collaborating with other songwriters -- Foster & Lloyd talk about recording She Knows What She Wants -- Foster & Lloyd talk about Marshall Crenshaw playing on the tune -- Foster & Lloyd talk about Happy For A While, and how it is the only lead vocal Lloyd has on the album -- Foster & Lloyd tell a funny story about George Hamilton V in their studio -- Foster & Lloyd talk about The Fat Lady Sings -- Foster & Lloyd talk about Always Be Here Loving You, and how relatable it can be to listeners -- Foster & Lloyd talk about how the song is about jealousy -- Foster & Lloyd talk about the inspiration behind the song Suzette -- Foster & Lloyd talk about songs often randomly coming to ones mind out of the blue -- Foster & Lloyd talk about Before The Heartache Rolls In, and how they wrote the song almost 5 years ago -- Foster & Lloyd talk about how often people mistake their names -- Foster & Lloyd talk about Lie To Yourself, written with Pat Terry -- Foster & Lloyd thank Biff and conclude the interview
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Foster & Lloyd; Foster, Radney; Lloyd, Bill; Collie, Biff;
